greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime p such that 2n*p+1 is also prime.
comment: These are the primes arising in A051899.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(29)=19 because 19 is the smallest prime p such that 2*29*p+1 is prime.
mathematica: Table[k = 1; While[! PrimeQ[2 n Prime@ k + 1], k++]; Prime@ k, {n, 120}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 26 2016 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = p=2; while(!isprime(2*n*p+1), p = nextprime(p+1)); p; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Dec 10 2013
results.author: _Labos Elemer_
